messages.title: Charlie on his Campaigns...
messages.content: In 2006, I was the only MSP proposing automatic jail for knife carrying; in 2010, 61 of Scotland's MSPs supported it - two short of a majority. It must come soon! In 2009 I proposed a Bill to regulate buses; 32 MSPs supported me, but Tory, Lib-Dem and SNP MSPs didn't; the Bill fell. But regulation is needed.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: A top priority. New jobs will be facilitated by public investment in promoting skills and infrastructure.
Will recruit up to 1,000 new literacy specialists to help teach those who struggle to read or write.
Tackling knife crime. 'Carry a knife: go to jail' is the determined policy to smash the blade culture.
Will not outsource road maintenance, buses, or cycling initiatives and will look to improve the link to Glasgow Airport.
A new Labour care service to better serve the needs of clients and carers.

housing.content: Many peoples lives are made a misery by rogue landlords and their anti-social tenants. That's why I fought for new laws.

politicalExperience.achievements: Led the Council administration that rebuilt the city's High schools and helped create some 40,000 jobs.

endorsements.endorsement: Charlie Gordon is the most experienced candidate in this Election.
